data.Title: Google Ads to Sunset Enhanced CPC in 2025
data.Description: Google Ads is phasing out Enhanced CPC (ECPC) bidding in March 2025. Campaigns using ECPC will be migrated to Manual CPC.

data.Title: Google Business Profile Appointment Link Monitoring
data.Description: Google Business Profiles will now send email notifications to businesses if appointment links on their profiles are found to be broken.

data.Title: Bing May Adopt ProductGroup Markup
data.Description: Bing is considering supporting ProductGroup structured data markup in the future, according to Microsoft's Fabrice Canel. While not yet implemented, the Bing team is monitoring its adoption.

data.Title: Bing's Handling of 308 Redirects
data.Description: Bing treats 308 redirects the same way as 301 redirects, confirming that link equity and signals are passed similarly for both redirect types.

data.Title: Bing Tests "See Details" Button for Product Listings
data.Description: Bing is experimenting with a new "See Details" button for product listings in search results. This button provides a more prominent call to action for users to view product information.

data.Title: Mediavine Enforces Policy Against Low-Quality AI Content
data.Description: Mediavine, an advertising management platform, has banned a publisher for excessive use of AI-generated content. This action highlights the platform's commitment to quality content and the potential consequences for publishers who rely heavily on AI.

data.Title: YouTube Studio Introduces Website Visits Goal for Promotions
data.Description: YouTube Studio now offers a "Website Visits" goal for video promotions, allowing creators to optimize campaigns for driving traffic to external websites directly from their YouTube channel.

data.Title: Google's August 2024 Core Update: Volatility and Impacts
data.Description: Google's August 2024 core update has finished rolling out, but search ranking volatility remains high. Analysis suggests a correlation between sites impacted by this update and those affected by previous updates in March 2024 and September 2023.

data.Title: Back Button Hijacking and SEO Implications
data.Description: The practice of "back button hijacking," where websites manipulate the browser's back button, is discussed in relation to its potential impact on user experience, Google's spam policies, and the Navboost signal.

data.Title: Google's AI Overviews Display Product Results for Commercial Queries
data.Description: Google's AI Overviews, a new feature on search result pages, are now incorporating product and shopping results for queries with commercial intent, indicating a shift towards a more integrated shopping experience.

data.Title: Overlap Between AI Overviews and Traditional Organic Results
data.Description: Research suggests that approximately 50% of the links displayed in Google's AI Overviews are duplicates of links found in traditional organic search results, raising questions about the distinctiveness and value of the new feature.

data.Title: Google Integrates Business Photos in Local Review Sentiments
data.Description: Google is enhancing its local search results by displaying business photos within the review sentiments section, providing users with a more visually rich and informative experience.

data.Title: Microsoft Partners with StopNCII to Combat Deepfakes on Bing
data.Description: Microsoft is collaborating with StopNCII to identify and remove abusive deepfake content, particularly non-consensual intimate imagery, from its Bing search engine, addressing the growing concern of AI-generated harmful content.

data.Title: Justice Department's Antitrust Case Against Google's Ad Tech
data.Description: The U.S. Department of Justice's antitrust lawsuit against Google's ad tech practices is set to begin. The case centers around allegations that Google holds a monopoly in the digital advertising market and engages in anti-competitive behavior.
